intro: Zephyranthes gilliesiana, commonly known as the fairy lantern or night bloomer, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous rhizomes and striking, showy flowers. The plant produces bell-shaped, white or pinkish flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Zephyranthes gilliesiana is also known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
